headline.print_headline: Big Benefits Are Seen From Eating Less Salt
headline.main: Big Benefits Are Seen From Eating Less Salt

docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists writing in The New England Journal of Medicine conclude that lowering the amount of salt people eat by even a small amount could reduce cases of heart disease, stroke and heart attacks.
docs.snippet: Scientists writing in The New England Journal of Medicine conclude that lowering the amount of salt people eat by even a small amount could reduce cases of heart disease, stroke and heart attacks.

docs.abstract: The first lady argues that keeping children healthy will keep the nation's economy healthy.
docs.lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, Michelle Obama asked the nation's mayors to enlist in what she hopes will be her foremost project: an ambitious, wide-ranging effort to reduce childhood obesity.
docs.snippet: The first lady argues that keeping children healthy will keep the nation's economy healthy.

headline.main: The Early Word: The Brown Effect

byline.original: By ASHLEY SOUTHALL and KATE PHILLIPS

docs.abstract: The aftermath of a surprising win for Republicans in Massachusetts.
docs.lead_paragraph: The effects of the stunning victory by Scott Brown are still settling in here in Washington and in Massachusetts, with the Republican's win signifying an end to the Democratic supermajority in the Senate and having major implications for the midterm elections.
docs.snippet: The aftermath of a surprising win for Republicans in Massachusetts.

headline.sub: Media Use Is Up to 7  1/2 Hours a Day, Study Finds;
headline.print_headline: If Your Children Are Awake, Then They’re Probably Online
headline.main: If Your Kids Are Awake, They’re Probably Online

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers once thought the use of electronic devices could not go up. They were wrong.
docs.snippet: Researchers once thought the use of electronic devices could not go up. They were wrong.

headline.seo: Mayor Bloomberg Moves to Shuffle Top Deputies at City Hall
headline.print_headline: Top Deputies Trading Places At City Hall
headline.main: Top Deputies Trading Places at City Hall

docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, acting on an idea he proposed in his inaugural address, is temporarily reassigning top deputies to other agencies in an effort to generate fresh ideas.
docs.snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, acting on an idea he proposed in his inaugural address, is temporarily reassigning top deputies to other agencies in an effort to generate fresh ideas.

docs.lead_paragraph: A growing number of well-off men are injecting a hormone to forestall aging. Does it work — or is it enough that they simply think it does?
docs.snippet: A growing number of well-off men are injecting a hormone to forestall aging. Does it work — or is it enough that they simply think it does?

headline.seo: In Reversal, U.S. Expresses Concern Over Additive  to Plastics
headline.print_headline: U.S. Concerned About The Risks From A Plastic
headline.main: F.D.A. Concerned About Substance in Food Packaging

byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris contributed reporting from Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a shift, the Food and Drug Administration will study the health risks from bisphenol-A, or BPA, which is widely used in plastic bottles and food containers.
docs.snippet: In a shift, the Food and Drug Administration will study the health risks from bisphenol-A, or BPA, which is widely used in plastic bottles and food containers.
